      "description":"<h4>Hanlan's Coffee Company - Ethical Purchasing Policy</h4><p>At Hanlan's, we know that our customers like to drink only the finest coffee from around the world. We also recognize that they want to be sure that the people who grow that coffee are treated fairly. Many coffee producers provide their employees with poor working conditions and low pay, which are practices that Hanlan's does not support. -- [1] --.</p><p>Coffee companies that buy their stock on the open market never know exactly where it comes from. But at Hanlan's, we take a different approach. We have exclusive contracts with farms in Guatemala, Ethiopia, and Vietnam. -- [2]--. Because of this, we know exactly who is producing our coffee and the conditions in which it is being grown. We appreciate all the hard work of our farmers and ensure that they have acceptable working conditions and wages. But our commitment doesn't end there. -- [3]--. Hanlan's pays them an additional 10 percent above curreny market prices as our way of saying 'Thanks.'</p><p>Furthermore, to give even more back to these communities, we have started the Hanlan's Development Foundation. Each year through this organization, we put five percent of our total corporate profits into building shcools, water pumps and purification plants, and health care facilities in the towns and villages near where our coffee is grown. The main foal is to make certain that all our workers' children are safe, healthy, and have the chance to go to school and receive a full education. -- [4] --.</p><p>Find out more about Hanlan's development projects, our coffee producers, and what you can do to support our cause at www.hanlancoffee.com/foundation.</p>",

At the beginning of the survey period, the city received just under a milion visitors a year, but the latest figures show this has jumped to over 1.4 milion.</p><p>There are a number of factors that ca account for this change. The new Sanchez Museum of Iberian Art and its nearby conference facilities to rail services from Valancia to Madrid and Barcelona have reduced travel time significantly. With a major airport expansion due to be completed before the end of the year, things are expected to get even better for Valencia.</p><p>In addition, the city government's launch of an international advertising campaign two years ago has also proved beneficial. The city was marketed by television, print, and social media as a tourism destination. Reaction to the campaign continues to be positive.</p><p>Finally, as well as its attraction tourists and business visitors, Valencia is increasingly being recognized as an excellent place to live. The consultancy Apollo and Company recently put the city in third place in a report measuring the quality of life in small European cities. They cited its lovely waterfront location, low housing costs, and modern infrastructure as reasons for its high place.</p>",

      "description":"<div style='border:2px solid blue;padding:10px;'><h4>Announcement for Woodlands Business Owners:</h4><p>The Woodlands Merchants Association is planning to host Thursday evening concerts on the Center Square lawn from May 28 through July 2, from 6 P.M. until 9 P.M. We have held the concerts over the past few years and have had a good turnout every time. However, these events do entail a significant expense for the association, as we most pay our performers. As a result, we are offering local businesses the opportunity to sponsor a concert. This will help the association to control costs while promoting your stores or shops to the public.</p><p>A sponsorship includes a banner with your business name on it that will be attached to the performance stage. You have the option of setting up a promotional booth on the lawn and are allowed to hand out flyers or give away coupons and product samples. Those sponsoring a concert for $500 or more will also have their business's name, logo, and contact information printed with event advertisements in <i>The Woodlands Times </i> newspaper.</p><p>The Woodlands Merchant Association aims to bring together the business community and local residents, and the sponsored concerts will be an enjoyable way to achieve that goal. If you would like to participate, contact the event coordinator, Dan Perry, at DanPerry@woodlandsmerchantsassn.com to finalize the sponsorship arrangements.</p></div><div style='border:2px solid yellow;padding:10px;margin-top:10px;overflow-x:scroll'><h4>Woodlands Merchants Association Summer Concert Schedule</h4><p>Below is the concert schedule.       "description":"<div style='justify-content:center;display: flex;'><div style='border-style: double;width:80%;padding:6px'><b>Gunton City Council to Consider Blandfolk Superstore Proposal</b><p>At a Gunton City Council meeting on May 2, members listened to a presentation from representatives of Blandfolk Superstore about building a branch locally. The retail giant proposed erecting an outlet measuring 9,500 square meters just within city limits on Medford Avenue. However, the chosen land has not yet been authorized for commercial establishments, so Blankfolk has requested that the property be rezoned. Gunton mayor Claire O'Rourke told representatives that the council would discuss the proposition this month and address it at their next meeting in June. A spokesperson for Blankfolk said the corporation hopes the proposal will pass, emphasizing that the development would provide employment for up to 190 local residents.</p></div> </div> <div style='border:1px solid blue;margin:10px;padding:10px;'> <div> <b style='font-size:22px'>Gunton Herald</b><br/>www.guntonherald.com <div style='display:flex;flex-wrap:wrap;justify-content: space-around;margin-top:10px;border-top:1px solid;border-bottom:1px solid;padding:4px'><span>Home</span>|<span>News</span>|<span>Sports</span>|<span>Business</span>|<span>Entertainment</span>|<span>Lifestyle</span>|<b>Opinion</b>|<span>Contact Us</span></div> </div> <p><b>Readers' Comments</b></p> <p>Ronald Pinero posted on May 7:<br/>I am writing in regard to an article printed in your newspaper's May 3 edition about the construction proposal from Blandfolk Superstore. As a long-time business owner in Gunton, I am concerned. I manage Ballas Boutique, a clothing store in the downtown area, and many of my friends and business acquaintances also operate private shops in the city. Large corporate retailers have forced many smaller stores out of business in other locations where they have opened, even when such establishments have been situated on the outskirts of towns. I'm not sure most businesses line mine will be able to compete without significantly dropping prices and, by extension, the quality of our godds. For now, Gunton is very vibrant and diverse city, and I hope the mayor and council members will reject the proposal in order to keep that way.</p> </div> <div style='border:1px solid pink;margin:10px;padding:10px'> <div style='background-color:#fafafa'> <table> <tr><td>TO</td><td style='padding-left:10px'>Ronald Pinero &lt;rpinero@dailymaily.com&gt;</td</tr> <tr><td>FROM</td><td style='padding-left:10px'>Adeline Morris &lt;amorris@guntoncoc.org&gt;</td</tr> <tr><td>SUBJECT</td><td style='padding-left:10px'>Request from Gunton COC</td</tr><tr><td>DATE</td><td style='padding-left:10px'>May 8</td</tr> </table> </div> <p>Dear Mr.Pinero,</p> <p>I came across your comments on the Gunton Herald Web site. You could give a short talk describing the concerns you mentioned in your comments. You are welcome to use visual aids, bring supporting documents, and invite others who share our concerns. Please let me know if you would like to participate.</p> <p>Sincerely yours,</p><p>Adeline Morris<br/>Secretary, Gunton Chamber of Commerce</p> </div>",

      "hintVn":"Good morning. {(74), (75)} <b>I called this meeting to discuss how all cashiers at our store should interact with customers. I've noticed that some of you are so focused on scanning items and getting people through the line quickly, that you're ignoring the customers.</b> We want to leave customers at our supermarket with a good impression, so it's crucial that you greet them. [(76)] <b>I'm now going to have you work in pairs to play the part of the cashier and customer to practice being friendly</b>, while also being fast and efficient<p><hr/>Chào buổi sáng. Tôi đã triệu tập cuộc họp này để thảo luận về cách mà tất cả nhân viên thu ngân tại cửa hàng của chúng ta nên tương tác với khách hàng. Tôi nhận thấy rằng một số bạn chỉ chăm chú vào việc scan các món đồ để mọi người bước qua nhanh chóng. Các bạn lại bỏ qua các khách hàng. Chúng ta muốn để lại cho khách hàng ở siêu thị của chúng ta một ấn tượng tốt, thì điều quan trọng nhất là các bạn phải niềm nở với khách hàng. Hãy thật thoải mái khi họ đến quầy tính tiền của bạn.       "testName":"ETS TOEIC 2018 - Test 01",
      "part":7,
      "description":"Local News<br/><br/><i>Monday, March 31</i><br/><br/>The Cloud Theater on Gordon Street will close at the end of this month, but this important piece of real estate won't be closed for long. The building has been sold to the Lakehurst Cinema Society (LCS). According to LCS Executive Director Kartik Malla, the group is planning to make some updates to the building before it reopens. He explained that the seats, screen, and sound systems will be replaced in all of the theaters.---[1]---.<br/><br/>&quot;However,&quot; Mr. Malla added, &quot;we'll be keeping one of the Cloud Theater's old projectors so we can continue to show classic films in their otiginal format.&quot;<br/><br/>Up to now, the Cloud Theater has played mainly art house, independent, and foreign films.---[2]---. The former owner, Mr. Eugene Sattler, who has now retired, always sought to make the Cloud Theater a haven for artistic films. He was successful for many years, but ticket sales have declined in recent years and he decided it was time to sell.---[3]---.<br/><br/>&quot;This was a hard decision to make,&quot; said Mr. Sattler. &quot;I will miss working at the theater. I am happy the LCS is going to bring new life to the old theater.&quot;<br/><br/>Under its new ownership, the theater will continue to show those artistic types of movies on special occasions. It will also show more mainstream movies that will appeal to families and children.<br/><br/>The society plans to reopen the theater to the public on July 1. In addition, it will continue to serve as host for the classic film festival that begins the first weekend in August and continues for ten days. Everything about the festival will remain the same except for one thing. The store has two unique features: it specializes in rare books and is open for business on Saturdays only. Evidently, walk-in sales make up only a small percentage of Mr. Carlson's business; the bulk of the store's revenue is generated bu orders placed over the telephone or online by universities, meseums, and private collectors.</div><div>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On Sunday The Treasure Box will be celebrating its sixtieth anniversary. &quot;When my mother, Willisa, opened the bookstore all those years ago on Green Edge Road, two blocks from here, she probably had no idea it would still be serving the public six decades later,&quot; Mr. Carlson said. The store still displays the original sign over the doorway. The interior retains the living-room atmosphere it always had, with its mismatched tables and chairs. One section of the store is filled with books about baseball, an abiding passion of the Carlson family. On Friday nights the store becomes an informal social club. Not surprisingly, members tend to enjoy conversation about rare books, literature, and baseball.</div><div>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Later this month Mr. Carlson will mark another milestone: he will be retiring from his teaching position. His retirement does not mean, however, that The Treasure Box will see extended business hours; it will continue to be open once a week. &quot;I am not retiring from one job just so that I can spend more time on another,&quot; Mr. Carlson said. &quot;Rather, the fact that I no longer will have to prepare for classes or grade students' papers means that I will be able to dedicate more time to my children and grandchildren.&quot;</div>",

      "description":"<div style='border:1px solid red;padding:8px'> CORDOVA (May 6) - Cordova city officials have begun preliminary discussions about what to do with Lowell Street Bridge, a historic city landmark that is in dire need of an upgrade. While costly restoration options are being considered, several factors make demolition a more likely outcome.<br/><br/>&quot;It's a tough decision and one we don't intend to make hastily,&quot; said city planner Colin Barnwell. &quot;So far, it seems that replacing the bridge makes the most financial sense.&quot;<br/><br/>Price isn't the only consideration, however. According to the structural engineer Steve Pachenco, traffic flow is another important factor. &quot;Highway 49 will soon be broadened from two lanes to four. Then, Lowell Street Bridge will no longer be able to accommodate the increase in vehicles,&quot; he said. &quot;The way I seeit, a wider, more modern bridge is inevitable.&quot;<br/><br/>For residents who want to share their opinions and ideas, the city council will be holding a public input session at Helman Square next Thursday at 11:00 A.M. </div> <div style='border:1px solid blue;padding:8px;margin-top:10px'><b>Letters to the Editor</b><p>May 7 - I'm writing inresponse to yesterday's article about Lowell Street Bridge. This bridge is an invaluable part of Cordova's cultural identity and it is in the city's best interst to keep it intact. Considering the tremendous amount of income the cultural-heritage-tourism industry brings to the city annually, I would argue that the short-term cost of restoring this historic landmark would be economically worthwhile.</p><p>-Maria Cantu, member of the Cordova Preservation Society (CPS)</p></div> <div style='margin-top:10px;background-color:#5c5c5c;padding-left:12px;padding-right:12px;padding-bottom:12px'><div style='background-color:#5c5c5c;text-align:center;width:100%;padding-bottom:4px'><span style='padding:6px;background-color:white'>*E-mail*</span></div><div style='overflow:scroll'><table> <tr> <td style='background-color:white;padding:4px'>To:</td> <td style='background-color:white;padding:4px;width:100%'>members@cordovaps.org</td> </tr> <tr> <td style='background-color:white;padding:4px'>From:</td> <td style='background-color:white;padding:4px;width:100%'>leo_contreras@cordovaps.org</td> </tr> <tr> <td style='background-color:white;padding:4px'>Date:</td> <td style='background-color:white;padding:4px;width:100%'>May 19</td> </tr> <tr> <td style='background-color:white;padding:4px'>Subject:</td> <td style='background-color:white;padding:4px;width:100%'>Lowell Street Bridge Update</td> </tr> </table></div><div style='background-color:white;padding:8px;margin-top:8px'>Dear CPS Members,<p>Congratulations! Thanks to our strong community presence at the city council event, and after countless phone calls to city council members, it looks like Lowell Street Bridge will not be demolished after all! <i>The Cordova Times</i> published an article today stating that the city is now planning to relocate the bridge to the Eastside ciltural district, where it will be used for foot traffic rather than motor vehicles.</p><p>This decision is surely due in part to the fact that each of you voiced your opinions last Thursday.</p><p> Thanks again,<br/>Leo Contreras, Cordova Preservation Society Community Organizer </p></div></div>",
      "mp3":"",

They also had concerns over its lack of power output. ---[2]---.<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition to the design challenges, the Long Ride factory, having been equipped to produce previous models, is not ready for production of the Flash JX hybrid. ---[3]---. Please note, however, that additional restrictions will be in force for accessing the island this summer. Unless they are members of an official tour, visitors to the park will be prohibited from setting foot on Prendis Island. This rule is also applies to individuals who may wish to visit the island independently using private watercraft. Such individuals may view the island from the water and may anchor offshore, but must not make landfall on the island.</p><p>The PNPA's official boat tours for visitors to the island are offered seven days a week throughout the year and depart at two-hour time intervals starting at 8 A.M. The final tour leaves at 4 P.M., except for the summer months of December through March, when this is extended to 6 P.M. Call 08 9776 5992 to make reservations. The official tour includes a brief visit to the island itself, where you can view bird-nesting areas with a PNPA park ranger as your anthorized ascort.</p><p><b>Payment and Reservations</b><br/>- Tours are capped at 18 participants. If your group is smaller than 15, we reserve the right to include other visitors in your tour.<br/>- Tickets are $20 per person for those 12 years of age over and $10 per child under the age of 12.<br/>- A nonrefundable deposit of $5 per person is required to hold a reservation for groups. Your deposit will be credited to your total group admission fee. If your party does not arrive at the specified time, we reserve the right to shorten the trip as necessary in order to avoid interfering with subsequent tours. Rescheduling cannot be considered.</p>",

To get input on the menu we'll be serving him, I've decided we should hold a special menu-tasting event on Saturday of next week.</p><p>I have a few suggestions for what we could serve at the menu tasting. How about preparing a hearty meatless entrée that can really hold its own? That way we can highlight our vegetarian-friendly offerings. Perhaps our steamed shellfish dish would be a good option too. I do insist, however, on offering the new specialty pizzas we're planning to introduce on our regular menu. That is, of course, assuming construction on the brick oven is completed by then. Also, I think we could serve al least one of our fruit desserts - they are always popular. But do know that I have full confidence in you, as Head Chef, to finalize the menu selections.</p><p>Lastly, I'd like to offer our menu-tasting patrons a chance tour the kitchen while they are here. I was quite impressed with the efficient design of your kitchen I look forward to sampling the new brick-oven pizzas when they're introduced. It's a shame you weren't able to offer them today.</p></div>",

not false or invented<br/><b>*abundant</b> (adj): more than enough<br/><b>*satisfying</b> (adj): making you feel pleased by providing what you need or want<br/><b>*original</b> (adj): existing since the beginning, or being the earliest form of something<br/><b>*free</b> (adv/adj): costing nothing, or not needing to be paid for<br/><b>*dessert</b> (n): sweet food eaten at the end of a meal<br/><b>*kitchen</b> (n): a room where food is kept, prepared, and cooked and where the dishes are washed<br/><b>*chicken</b> (n): a type of bird kept on a farm for its eggs or its meat, or the meat of this bird that is cooked and eaten<br/><b>*halibut</b> (n): a big, flat sea fish that can be eaten<br/><b>*cake</b> (n): a sweet food made with a mixture of flour, eggs, fat, and sugar<br/><b>*eggplant</b> (n): an oval, purple vegetable that is white inside and is usually eaten cooked<br/><b>*brick oven</b> (n): bricks, usually having a circular or oval dome; often located within the hearth of the principal fireplace of a colonial home, usually in a corner of the hearth and a few feet above it<br/><b>*inspection</b> (n): the act of looking at something carefully, or an official visit to a building or organization to check that everything is correct and legal",

Local vendors pointed to an increase in the wholesale price of milk, which has caused their own prices to rise significantly.<br/><br/>To offset the decrease in sales, many ice cream stores are stocking alternative deserts that do not contain dairy. For example, Giordano's Desert Shoppe in Wellington has begun selling fruit ices.       "description":"<div style='text-align:center;font-weight:900'>Matt Alcheri's Adventurous Leap</div><div>By <i>Erika Quade, Badger Dispatch</i></div><br/><div>MILWAUKEE (12 January) - Matt Alcheri has created music for dozens of films, including <i>Seeking Eleanor</i>, which earned him the Cinearts Award for Best Original Music. Recently, he has lent his considerable composing skills to <i>Final Chance</i>, a video game produced by Silhouette Gaming Systems (SGS), which has been creating interactive entertainment for 10 years now.</div><div>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Mr. Alcheri was introduced to the managing director of SGS, Harry Jansson, at a social event hosted by Ms. Chandra Bixby, who, on occasion, has collaborated with Mr. Alcheri in composing film scores. Mr. Jansson proceeded to invite Mr. Alcheri to write the music for <i>Final Chance</i>.</div><div>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In a phone interview, Mr. Alcheri said that he was &quot;quite impressed&quot; with the graphics and animation of <i>Final Chance</i>. &quot;It left me with the sense that I was watching a movie, and so I did not hesitate to collaborate on the project,&quot; said the renowned composer. He further remarked that writing the score for the video game was virtually identical to composing the music for a movie.</div><div>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&quot;All I had to do was write music that matches the atmosphere of the various scenes depicted in the game,&quot; he added.</div><div>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&quot;As for Mr. Jansson, he said in the same interview that with pre-orders for <i>Final Chance</i> standing currently at 200,000 copies, he has no doubt that the latest SGS product, scheduled to be released on March 20, will be a success.</div>",

(A là cuối cùng, B là hàng ngày, C là đã được chỉnh sửa).<hr/><b>132. will discuss</b><br/>Đây là sự kiện trong tương lai nên B và D là phù hợp. Nhưng ta không thấy 1 mốc thời gian nào cụ thể trong tương lai để việc nào đó được hoàn thành -> loại D, B đúng.<hr/><b>133. This will allow us to keep a larger variety of items in stock.</b><br/>Câu này cần logic với cả câu trước: quyết định chuyển sang Kyoto, và câu sau: việc chuyển sẽ mất 2 tuần -> đáp án A. Điều này cho phép chúng tôi có thể giữ 1 lượng hàng dự trữ lớn hơn là phù hợp.<hr/><b>137. during</b><br/>Chỉ có đáp án C. Trong suốt là phù hợp, nghĩa là trong suốt thời gian đó (2 weeks), chúng tôi sẽ không thể vận chuyển hàng ra nước ngoài.<hr/><b>138. Xét về ý nghĩa phù hợp chỉ có D. trông đợi, dự tính là phù hợp.<hr/><b>142. presentation</b><br/>Vị trí cần 1 danh từ, cụ thể là bài thuyết trình -> đáp án D.<br/><br/><i>TOEIC Academy</i>",

The project is estimated to cost $1.6 bilion, and a new terminal is scheduled to open for international service in approximately one year.<br/><br/>The airport, however, sits on a confined piece of land, which presents significant challenges to increasing the number of takeoffs and landings. If the airport remains limited to its current two runways, the capacity to handle air traffic could be reached within three years.<br/><br/>To address the problem, officials overseeing the Onalia City Airport project have contracted a group of engineers from Wilford Engineering to explore the posibility of extending a third runway over the Pacific Ocean. The engineering firm will survey the area for six months before presenting their findings and recommending a plan of action.<br/><br/>Runways that extend over water are not unprecedented.       "description":"<div style='background-color:#5c5c5c;padding:4px;border:1px solid'> <div style='overflow-x:scroll'> <table style='border-collapse:collapse;width:100%'> <tr> <td style='padding:4px;border:1px solid #5c5c5c;background-color:white'><b>To:</b></td> <td style='padding:4px;border:1px solid;border-left:4px solid ;background-color:white'>Ben Greenidge</td> </tr> <tr> <td style='padding:4px;border:1px solid #5c5c5c;background-color:white'><b>From:</b></td> <td style='padding:4px;border:1px solid;border-left:4px solid ;background-color:white'>Nirmala Deokaran</td> </tr> <tr> <td style='padding:4px;border:1px solid #5c5c5c;background-color:white'><b>Subject:</b></td> <td style='padding:4px;border:1px solid;border-left:4px solid ;background-color:white'>Request</td> </tr> <tr> <td style='padding:4px;border:1px solid #5c5c5c;background-color:white'><b>Date:</b></td> <td style='padding:4px;border:1px solid;border-left:4px solid ;background-color:white'>13 January</td> </tr> </table> </div> <div style='padding:6px;background-color:white;margin-top:3px'>Dear Mr. Greenidge,<p>I kindly request that management consider entering our company in the CASATO Virtual Business Tournament. The competition, organized by the Caribbean &amp; South American Trade Organization (CASATO), requires participants to develop and implement business strategies that ensure the long-term stability and continuity of an imaginary company.</p><p>Participation in this event could be highly beneficial to our company. Though many tournament participants occupy non-decision-making positions in their organization, the contest demands that they apply a broad range of leadership practices. In the process, most become more appreciative of the day-to-day realities and complexities of managing an actual company. Moreover, they tend to apply the skills acquired or refined during the competition - such as collaboration, analysis, and problem-solving - in actual work situations. Additionally, participation in the event may increase our company's profile, opening up new markets for our products. Roughly six months after last year's tournament, about one-third of the 70 companies that had taken part in that event reported an increase in regional business activities.</p><p>Details about the tournament are available at www.casato.org/events/tournament_information.</p><p>Sincerely,</p>Nirmala Deokaran<br/>Flight Dispatcher<br/>Omicron Air Cargo</div></div><div style='margin-top:10px;border:1px solid blue;padding:4px'><div style='padding:4px;border:1px solid;overflow-x:scroll'>http://www.casato.org/events/tournament_information</div><div style='text-align:center;padding:6px'>CASATO</div><div style='padding:6px;border:2px solid #5c5c5c'><div style='text-align:center'><b>CASATO VIRTUAL TOURNAMENT</b></div><br/><b>Entry information</b><br/><br/>Registration for this year's tournament is open from 1 March to 1 April, while the tournament starts on 8 June. No more than two teams per company can be registered. The top three teams will be announced on 3 July and will be honored during a ceremony to be held on 19 August at Hotel Baía da Lua in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.</div></div><div style='margin-top:12px'><div style='text-align:center;padding-bottom:4px'><b>A Virtual Breakthrough for Omicron</b></div><div style='padding:4px 0px;border-top:2px solid #5c5c5c;border-bottom:2px solid #5c5c5c'>9 July - The CASATO Virtual Tournament pits teams from companies based in the Caribbean and South America against one another to determine which one can run the most successful virtual business. While teams from various Guyana-based companies have participated in the competition since its inception, none had over won. Last week, however, the team representing Omicron Air Cargo in this year's event learned it had earned third place in a field consisting of 109 teams, which represented 85 companies. Omicron's winning team was led by Nirmala Deokaran. The team has been honored with the CASATO Virtual Business Award.</div></div>",

      "hint":"By + N + O in London.<br/>{*opening} (n)",
      "hintVn":"<b>105. opening</b><br/>Trước chỗ cần điền là một giới từ, sau lại là một danh từ thì giữa đó sẽ điền V-ing. By + V-ing + N: Bằng cách làm việc gì.<br/><br/>Dịch nghĩa: Bằng cách mở thêm văn phòng ở London, Paris và Madrid, Sedgehill Ltd. đã tiếp tục mở rộng vào các thị trường nước ngoài.<br/><br/><i>TOEIC Academy</i>",

One area where we can realize savings is in printing and copy documents.</p><p>Many of us have been making color copies of basic documents, such as meeting minutes, product documentation drafts, and budget sheets. ---[1]---. While multicolor documents are more attractive and attention-grabbing than black-and-white ones, color ink cartridges are very expensive. Purchasing frequent replacements ultimately leaves us with less money to spend on things like business travel and social events. ---[2]---.</p><p>Rather than instituting a system wherein all jobs must first be approved by the department supervisors, I would prefer that employees make their own decisions about printing and copying. ---[3]---. Please reserve the use of color for only those cases where visial appeal is a relevant factor. ---[4]---. Thank you for your attention to this matter.</p>",

      "description":"<div style='border:1px solid;padding:4px'><div style='text-align:center'><b> Respite for Commuters</b></div><p>A new ride-sharing app is gaining in popularity as bus and taxi fees continue to rise and commuters continue to look for more efficient routes. Jordan Mills, a small business owner who commutes into downtown from his home in Brentwood has to transfer buses twice, then, take the subway to get to his workplace. Not only did he find the commute quite costly and uncomfortable in the rush-hour crowds, he found it time consuming. But with the availability of the new app Freewheel, he found that he saved time and money with a quick ride available within 5 minutes of flagging for a ride from any location he was at. &quot;This is definitely the future of transportation,&quot; said Jordan. &quot;I can't get to work and back any other way now.&quot;</p>Jordan Mills isn't the only commuter who feels this way. An estimated 2000 new commuters in the city of Sherwood alone are expected to use the ride-sharing app within the next year and almost 500 new drivers have signed up to the program. Freewheel is available for download at the Freewheel website and at Miniapp.com and Amacom.com.</div><div style='border:1px solid blue;padding:4px;margin-top:10px'><div style='background-color:#fafafa;text-align:center;border:1px solid'>www. freewheel.com/history</div><p>The idea for Freewheel began when Michael Owens and his co-workers first started a carpooling program at the company they worked at. Owens had to transfer the subway three times and the bus twice to get to work and although he could drive, the parking was limited. He managed the group by assigning different drivers and mapped out routes to each co-worker's homes. He created an app that everyone could connect and communicate through so that the designated drivers and passengers could easily find each other. Five years later, Freewheel is now a major company with tens of thousands of users, both drivers and commuters around the country.</p>Freewheel is dedicated to keeping the cost of commuting down and the efficiency up. In time, it hopes to bring its services to people around the world.</div><div style='border:1px solid red;padding:4px;margin-top:10px'><div style='text-align:center'><b>Technology Initiatives</b><br/>is proud to present the<br/>New Innovation Award to;<br/>Michael Owens, CEO of Freewheel</div><p>This award recognizes the innovation and creativity of new talent in the technology industry. It also acknowledges the effort to help consumers through the use of technology with a novel idea that has transformed the transportation community.</p><p>Susan Vaneer</p>Executive Mananager, Technology Initiatives</div>",

Jordan Mills, một chủ doanh nghiệp nhỏ đi vào trung tâm thành phố từ nhà ở Brentwood phải chuyển xe buýt hai lần, sau đó, đi tàu điện ngầm để đến nơi làm việc. Anh ta không chỉ thấy chi phí đi lại khá tốn kém và không thoải mái trong giờ cao điểm, mà còn thấy nó tốn thời gian. Nhưng với sự có mặt của ứng dụng Freewheel mới, anh ta thấy rằng anh ta đã tiết kiệm thời gian và tiền bạc với một chuyến đi nhanh với khoảng 5 phút sau khi gắn cờ cho bất kỳ địa điểm nào anh ta đang đứng. &quot;Đây chắc chắn là tương lai của giao thông vận tải,&quot; Jordan nói. &quot;Tôi không thể đi làm và quay về nhà bằng bất kỳ cách nào khác bây giờ.&quot;</p>Jordan Mills không phải là người đi lại duy nhất cảm thấy như vậy. Ước tính có khoảng 2000 hành khách mới ở thành phố Sherwood dự kiến sẽ sử dụng ứng dụng chia sẻ đi xe trong năm tới và gần 500 tài xế mới đã đăng ký tham gia chương trình. Freewheel có sẵn sàng để được tải xuống tại trang web Freewheel và tại Miniapp.com và Amacom.com.</div><div style='border:1px solid blue;padding:4px;margin-top:10px'><div style='background-color:#fafafa;text-align:center;border:1px solid'>www. freewheel.com/history</div><p>Ý tưởng cho Freewheel bắt đầu khi Michael Owens và đồng nghiệp lần đầu tiên bắt đầu một chương trình đi chung xe tại công ty mà họ làm việc. Owens đã phải chuyển tàu điện ngầm ba lần và xe buýt hai lần để đi làm và mặc dù anh ta có thể lái xe, bãi đậu xe bị hạn chế. Anh ta quản lý nhóm bằng cách chỉ định các tài xế khác nhau và vạch ra các tuyến đường đến nhà của mỗi đồng nghiệp. Ông đã tạo ra một ứng dụng mà mọi người có thể kết nối và liên lạc thông qua để các tài xế và hành khách được chỉ định có thể dễ dàng tìm thấy nhau. Năm năm sau, Freewheel hiện là một công ty lớn với hàng chục ngàn người dùng, cả tài xế và người đi làm trên khắp đất nước. Freewheel giúp giữ chi phí đi lại thấp và hiệu quả thì tăng lên. Trong thời gian tới, nó hy vọng sẽ mang dịch vụ của mình đến mọi người trên khắp thế giới.</div><div style='border:1px solid red;padding:4px;margin-top:10px'><div style='text-align:center'><b>Sáng kiến công nghệ</b><br/>tự hào giới thiệu<br/>Giải thưởng sáng tạo mới để;<br/>Michael Owens, CEO của Freewheel</div><p>Giải thưởng này ghi nhận sự đổi mới và sáng tạo của tài năng mới trong ngành công nghệ.       "description":"<div style='padding:4px;border:1px solid blue'>To: Raquel Jenkins &lt;cservice@starproducts.com&gt;<br/>From: Jose Ramos&lt;jramos.zipnet.com&gt;<br/>Date: October 14<br/>Subject: Defective Hose<p>Dear Ms. Jenkins,</p><p>Recently, I purchased 5,000 yards of XP100 industrial hosing from your company, Star Products. The hosing was listed as capable of handling up to 1,000 pounds of pressure per square inch (psi). My company, Advanced Dynamic Cleaning, refitted all of our pressure washers with your hosing at considerable cost and time. Every single one of our pressure washers failed somewhere along the hosing from the joint of the gun to the compressor. Our compressors only create 500 psi, so I have to conclude that there is some defect in the design of your hose. I would like to get a refund of my purchase or a replacement of my order with hosing that meets industry standards. Because we went over budget last year on employee appreciation events, I think it would be wise to find more affordable recreational activities. Attached is a breakdown of projected expenses for summer events that I have planned.</p>July 6: Anchorage Flower Festtival<br/>July 22: Art in the Park at Lawrence Park<br/>August 6: Bicycle Tours of the Anchorage Countryside<br/>August 19: FHlorrseback Riding at Sweet Meadow Ranch<br/><br/>I have scheduled fewer outdoor activities this year compared to last year. This year I would like to take advantage of a new outdoor recreational opportunity that I read about on the Anchorage Reporter website. You can read the article by clicking on this link: www.anchoragereporterr.com/new_trails<br/><br/>Please let me know your opinion,<br/>Suzie Mason<br/>Human Resources Manager</div><div style='border:1px solid red;padding:4px;margin-top:10px'><div style='text-align:center'><b>Anchorage Reporter</b><br/>Bike Tours of the Anchorage Countryside to Start August 6</div><p>May 2—The Anchorage Bike Club will be hosting an annual bike riding event this summer, beginning on August 6 and running through August 7. The event will start at 10:00 A.M. on both days at the Anchorage Community Center, If you are driving a vehicle to the starting point, it would be better to use the parking lot behind the community center.</p><p>Anchorage Bike Club President Jean Frost stated, &quot;The xides will range from 5 to 20 miles and will take bikers through scenic areas in Anchorage, Overall, the bike tours will go ahead at a leisurely pace so that bikers of all skill levels can participate. However, local bikers with ample experience might lead a faster-paced group.&quot;</p>Bikers in the tours will learn about riding techniques, bicycle maintenance, and proper nutrition half an hour before the event starts. AU participants must have biking helmets on. They are also encouraged to bring their own water to prevent dehydration while biking.</div><div style='border:1px solid brown;padding:4px;margin-top:10px'><div style='text-align:center'><b>BICYCLE TOUR SIGN-UP SHEET</b></div><p>If you intend to participate in the August 6 bicycle tour, please write down your name, department, and level of experience or fittness. If we have enough people sign up as advanced, we can coordinate two separate tours. If there are not enough for two tours, we would like to encourage all riders to stay together so that everyone can join in the team building exercises we have planned.       "description":"<div style='padding:4px;border:1px solid blue'>April 5—Clearwater Hospital in downtown Scranton has launched a new pen pal letter-writing program between terminally ill hospital patients and adult volunteers. Hospital Director Zack Chambers, who was recently presented with an Outstanding Leader Award from the National Health Care Alliance, started the program to create stronger connections between the hospital and the community. Mr. Chambers encourages adults of all types and occupations to apply even if they don't feel completely qualified. Simply visit the Clearwater Hospital website and become a member of the hospital free of charge.<br/><br/>&quot;I hope through this program, volunteers can form close relationships with patients to help them get through these difficult times in their lives,&quot; said Mr. Chambers. He also hopes that the program will lead to more people visiting terminally ill patients in person.</div><div style='margin-top:10px;padding:4px;border:1px solid brown'>Clearwater Hospital<br/>May 4<p>Monica Greene<br/>4100 Washington Road<br/>Scranton, Wisconsin 54481</p><p>Dear Ms. Greene,</p><p>I was delighted to receive your letter, I am very excited to have been paired with you as pen pals. Please let me know when the most convenient time would be for me to meet you.</p>I look forward to hearing from you,<br/>Jessica Wrigt</div><div style='padding:10px;margin-top:10px;border:1px solid yellow'>Dear Jessica,<br/><br/>You don't know how much I appreciate your kind words. I would welcome a visit, if you truly wanted to come, and the best time would be for our meeting is the Thanksgiving holiday party here at the center I suppose. My own family might be here as well. If it is too much for you, or if you can't get the time off of work, don't worry about it too much.
